title.narrative: ILO Employment (Emergency Unemployment and Employment Stabilization Fund)

description.narrative:
The emergency unemployment and employment stabilization fund (EUESF) will be set up and managed within the Social Security Corporation. The project management is by the tripartite SSC Board according to SSC internal rules and regulations and utilizing all existing monitoring, reporting, oversight and control mechanisms and systems in place in the SSC. The EUESF will receive funding from donors either directly or through an Employment Recovery Fund, the ILO will administer that. As an innovative instrument, the ERF will support the efforts of the Ministry and of the Social Security Corporation to implement the Employment Recovery Strategy of the Government of Jordan.
The ultimate aim is that the National social protection systems achieve substantial coverage of the poor and the vulnerable.
The projects’ main objectives are: - Extend income protection to vulnerable workers otherwise not covered in the COVID and post COVID context. - Combine the support of emergency response measures with the development of appropriate and financially sustainable participation mechanisms to encourage the target group to participate in social security on a more permanent basis. - Formalize a segment of workers that are now predominantly working in the informal sector. - Cover a large share of workers in vulnerable categories with unemployment insurance and other core social security benefits.
